Uses of Interface
cams.view.base.Displayable

Packages that use Displayable
Package
Description
cams.view
A group of user interface elements.
cams.view.base
A group of base user interface elements which are extended to create more specific user interface components.
cams.view.components
A group of specific user interface components which extends from the cams.view.base package.
cams.view.components.auth
A group of user interface used to get inputs for user authentication and changing user password.
cams.view.components.camp
A group of user interface components specific to the camp functionality.
cams.view.components.repliable
A group of user interface menus Users can use to interact with Repliable objects.
cams.view.components.staff
A group of user interface menus accessible by Staff.
cams.view.components.student
A group of user interface menus accessible by Students.

    Methods in cams.view with parameters of type Displayable
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static DisplayController
    DisplayController.getInstance(Displayable initialDisplay)
    Instantiates and initializes singleton with initial user interface element.
    void
    DisplayController.setNextDisplay(Displayable displayable)
    Sets the user interface element to be displayed next.

    Class

    Base class for all dismissible pop-up user interface elements.

    Dismissible pop-up when user selects an invalid choice in a menu.

    Base class for all user interface elements with actionable selections.

    Base class for user interface elements which requests user input.

    The boundary class displaying a Form which the Student can use to edit the selected Enquiry they have submitted.

    The boundary class displaying a Form which the committee member can use to edit the selected Suggestion they have submitted.

    The boundary class displaying a Form which the Student can use to submit a new Enquiry to a specific Camp.
    class

    The boundary class displaying a Form which the Student can use to submit a new Suggestion to the Camp they are committee member for.
